_comment: To create a new event, the syntax must be exact or JSON will throw a fit
Put the event in the array of events below, just copy and paste one of the previous events (brackets too).
Every event NEEDS a title, image local file path, description, link, and date. Any extraneous data will not be used.
For the IMAGE path: put the image in 'images/eventIcons' and simply put the filename in this file.
Visit here for a JSON syntax guide: https://www.tutorialspoint.com/json/json_quick_guide.htm
To leave a category blank, just put two quotes with nothing in between.

events.title: Workshops Hosted by The POGIL Project
events.description: Multidisciplinary workshops for college faculty and high school teachers

events.title: POGIL Activity Writing Workshop
events.description:
Four 3-hour sessions (1-4 pm ET) over four days
The IntroCS POGIL Project has funding available to cover your registration fees - apply here

events.title: IntroCS POGIL Cohort 2021
events.description:
Cohort members will attend two specific workshops for the IntroCS Cohort (July 14 and July 23),
in addition to a Fundamentals of POGIL workshop (July 12-13 or May 17-18)
and a POGIL Classroom Facilitation workshop (July 19-22)

events.title: POGIL Classroom Facilitation Workshop
events.description:
Four 3-hour sessions (1-4 pm ET) over four days
The IntroCS POGIL Project has funding available to cover your registration fees - apply here

events.title: Fundamentals of POGIL Workshop
events.description:
Two 3-hour sessions (1-4 pm ET) over two days (May 17-18, July 12-13, August 4-5)
The IntroCS POGIL Project has funding available to cover your registration fees - apply here

events.title: POGIL Writer's Retreat
events.description:
A more advanced retreat with more individual mentoring than the July 26-30 Activity Writing Workshop
The IntroCS POGIL Project has funding available to cover your registration fees - apply here

events.title: 2021 POGIL NCAPP
events.description:
The National Conference to Advance POGIL Practice (NCAPP) is a virtual conference
for experienced POGIL instructors to develop their skills as a POGIL practitioner and
to broaden their participation in the POGIL community

events.title: SIGCSE 2021
events.description:
March 16, 8-9:45 pm ET: "Measuring Students' Sense of Belonging in Introductory CS Courses"
March 18, 8-9:45 pm ET: "Collaborative Learning, Self-Efficacy, and Student Performance in CS1 POGIL"
March 20, 4-6:45 pm ET: "Improving Online Collaborative Learning with POGIL Practices"

events.title: SIGCSE 2020
events.description:
March 11: IntroCS POGIL 2019 Cohort - Pre-conference Event
March 11: POGIL Workshop
Virtual POGIL BOF (video and supplemental materials)

events.title: POGIL Workshop
events.description: POGIL Workshop at Capital University in Colombus, OH.

events.title: POGIL Workshops on Request
events.description: POGIL Workshops to be scheduled on request.
